alert.note: Alert for Cherokee; York (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 27 at 7:21PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western York and central Cherokee Counties through 800 PM EDT... At 721 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Gaffney, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Gaffney, Blacksburg, Sharon, Hickory Grove, Smyrna, Kings Mountain State Park, Cherokee Falls, Draytonville, Thicketty and Kings Creek. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
